pages.text:
Join and Support
There are many great (numerous) ways to support the Art Center and several options are actually 100% tax-deductible! We welcome any and all interest in supporting our mission.
We are a 501c3 non-profit organization. We rely on membership dues and donations.
Your generous donations help us keep the cost of classes and educational programs low, provide summer and fall programs for youth and teens and cover regular operating costs required to keep our doors open and free to everyone.
Marco Island Center for the Arts is not a city service, however, we are grateful for a wonderful relationship with the City of Marco Island and for the donations and support of the many community groups and friends in the area that help us further our mission. Your donations help make sure the Art Center can continue to operate in and positively impact our community for many years to come​
Please consider making a donation, or becoming a Sponsor of future fundraising or other exciting Events and Programs.
Become a Member
Donate Now
Become a Volunteer
Did you know?
A new universal charitable deduction allows taxpayers who do not itemize their returns to receive a tax deduction of up to $300 for cash charitable donations to 501(c)(3) nonprofit organizations during the calendar year.
For taxpayers that itemize returns, the limit on the total percentage of Adjusted Gross Income (AGI) eligible for the charitable deduction has been lifted. For questions regarding these new deductions, please consult your tax advisor.

Fun For the Whole Family
Marco Island Center for the Arts welcomes you to join the Art Family as we work every year to broaden the scope of activities and events for all ages.   The Art Center offers selected family-friendly activities that encourage our community of parents, grandparents, and youth to join together in celebrating art.

Submit Your Work
Each year Marco Island Center for the Arts has several open calls to submit art for an exhibition in our Rush and Lauritzen Galleries.  These exhibitions are usually themed so that the art that is submitted has a general cohesiveness and will offer an artistic expression of the theme.  To submit your work for one of our CTA shows please print the submission waiver and tags and submit with the artwork at the time of intake.
Marco Island Center for the Arts is inclusive and provide equal and equitable opportunities for all artists who submit artwork.  All applicants will be considered without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status or other applicable legally protected characteristics.  We do not just accept diversity – we celebrate it and thrive on it for the benefit of all.
All 2D submissions for Call to Artists and Shows are required to follow the following instruction guidelines
(courtesy of David Fuller of the Gallery Committee who took the time to create an easy to understand guide)
DOWNLOAD HANGING GUIDLINES HERE
For general CTA art submissions to the Marco Island Art Center, please click below to download the required form

ELIGIBILITY
The Center’s call-to-artist exhibits are open to all artists unless otherwise stated.
CATEGORIES
Audio Visual
Clay
Fiber
Glass
Graphic art
Jewelry
Mixed media
Painting
Photography
Sculpture
SUBMISSIONS
Submissions are accepted either in-person or by filling in the form below.
The deadline for online submissions is one day prior and in-person same day submissions are accepted.
For in-person submissions, submissions can be accepted in person the day of intake however we ask that you please download, print, and bring in the waiver with your in-person submission on the day of intake.
Waiver for Call to artist paper submission
.
NUMBER OF SUBMISSIONS
3 piece maximum per artist in CTA gallery shows with the exception of the Adult Student and Member Shows where the maximum is 2 pieces per artist. Both diptych and triptych work count as 1 piece each.
ENTRY RULES
Work must be original and not previously exhibited in the Center for the Art’s galleries or gift shop.* There will be no giclées or enhanced giclées allowed.
Work must be completed within the past three years.
Pieces must be for sale at a price set by the artist prior to intake.*
A 30% commission is retained by the Center for the Arts on all members’ sales, and a 40% commission is retained on all non-members’ sales.
All 2D work must be ready to hang with wires. Wires must be wrapped and taped and set to hang 3 inches from top of the frame. No saw tooth hangers allowed.
All 2D work must be framed unless 1 1/2 inch deep Gallery wrap. Gallery wrapped-canvas must have no exposed staples and the edges must be painted and finished.
3D pieces must be ready to display. Pedestals are limited.
Size limitations:* – Size includes the size of the artwork including the frame.
• 2D/wall art: 36″ x 48″ maximum.
• 3D/pedestal art: 14″ maximum foot print/base and 4′ maximum height.
• 3D/floor art: 3.5′ x 3.5′ width x 7′ height.
Dirty or scratched mats or frames will not be accepted. All frames must be sturdy and presentable.
AV entries must be entered with their own projection & sound system, or on a laptop computer that does not exceed size requirements of other media.*
* Exceptions may be approved by the Executive Director and/or gallery committee at their discretion – Requests for exception to any of these rules must be made a minimum of one week prior to intake date. Art that has not been pre-approved will not be accepted upon intake.
ENTRY FEES
All artists who participate in a call to artist show must pay the following entry fees: (no fees for the Adult Student CTA)
Members:
$20 for 1 piece
$25 for 2 pieces
$30 for 3 pieces
Non-members:
$25 for 1 piece
$30 for 2 pieces
$35 for 3 pieces
JUDGING
Submitted art will be judged in accordance with the specified theme and quality standards. Winners will then be chosen.
AWARDS
For each mixed media judged art show the Center for the Arts will announce 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place winners and 2 honorable mentions. Winners will be awarded ribbons. No entry fee will be required for the Adult Student show but it will be judged and ribbons will be awarded
DELIVERY AND PICK-UP
All work must be delivered directly to the Center for the Arts on the date and during the time provided on the call to artist schedule. Entries that arrive early, late or after show is hung will not be accepted. End-of-show pick-up times are listed on the Call-to-Artists schedule. (Exceptions may be made upon request by the Executive Director and/or gallery committee.)
RECEPTION
Art receptions are held each month on Second Tuesday.
END OF SHOW
This is mandatory. At intake you will receive notification of what date to pick up your work. We do not have sufficient storage for all work, therefore all participants must make arrangements for pick-up or they may be charged a storage fee of $5 a day. The Center for the Arts is NOT responsible for work that is not picked up, and if after one month the artwork has not been picked up by the artist responsible it will be considered a donation and become part of our inventory.
To submit work for consideration for an exhibition in
La Petite Galerie (ONLY) as seen in above photo,
please fill out the form below and click the
NEXT
button at the bottom of the page to upload required attachments (bio/cv, artist statement, and 3-5 jpegs of artist’s work).
Send email of pieces and information to
Patricia@marcoisland.org

Become A Member or Renew your Membership
As a member of the Marco Island Center for the Arts, you help to support programming unique to the Art Center, and most importantly you have an opportunity to contribute to and support local, state, and national programs in the arts.
The 2025-2026 membership season begins October 1, 2025
Advanced 2025-2026 membership sales begin April 1, 2025.
Monthly art exhibitions with signature 2
nd
Tuesday Art receptions
Over 100 classes and workshops for adult students
Children and youth summer workshops
Musical Interlude Series
Arts Center Theatre
Outdoor arts and crafts shows
Cars as Art
And more…
Additionally, throughout the year we offer numerous cultural experiences and fundraising events that incorporate the arts and are in collaboration with other organizations.
– NEW –
Marco Island Center for the Arts has joined the North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM) Association, making it possible for Art Center Members with a
Dual/Family, Friend, Benefactor or Angel Membership
to receive free admission, gift shop discounts, and other benefits at more than 1,000 museums in North America. All you have to do is present your Art Center Membership Card with a gold North American reciprocal to receive benefits. For a list of participating institutions and more details,
https://narmassociation.org/
.  Please call the institution that you plan to visit prior to your arrival to verify reciprocal admission and other benefits.

Are you a Student?
If you are a high school or college student (age 22 or younger), we offer a special $12/year membership just for you!
Join Now

More than a building…
The Center for the Arts is more than a building.  The spacious grounds of the Center include space for many returning fairs, festivals, and events.
Arts and Crafts Fairs
Outdoor Art and Craft Shows
Saturday -Sunday, Jan 17- 18, 2026
Saturday-Sunday Feb 7-8, 2026
Saturday -Sunday, Mar 28 – 29, 2026
There is no charge to attend any of the Outdoor Art Shows.
These outdoor arts and craft fairs are organized by Pam Patullo and potential vendors can reach her at 732-682-3230 or by email at ppatullocreations@msn.com
Cars as Art
Magnificent vintage cars are displayed and judged by professional artists and not car experts.  The awards are always a surprise.   This event has become a must-attend event for car lovers and enthusiasts in the greater Southwest Florida region. Suggested donation $5 per person.
